channel.name: Generating proof with a ZKProgram throws an unknown exception without any stack trace

messages.content: Can you paste error ?

```
thrown: Array [
      0,
      Array [
        248,
        MlBytes {
          "c": "Assert_failure",
          "l": 14,
          "t": 0,
        },
        -11,
      ],
      Array [
        0,
        MlBytes {
          "c": "src/lib/pickles/step.ml",
          "l": 23,
          "t": 0,
        },
        511,
        37,
      ],
    ]
```
sure, here is the error

```
Also, all the logic in my nextStep method is correct as all the asserts were passed and the final log before return was run
```

This is a misunderstanding, I think.  These methods are executed multiple times, so seeing a log doesn't mean that the execution reached the log line _on every execution_.  Can you paste your whole circuit code?
I've already using cache and my maximum memory for nodejs is 8GB.  And I believe this script should be run when inside my proving script, right?
Yes, just add Memory.info("step 1") to your script after every call to ZkProgram. Usually you see such kind of errors when RSS memory is 7GB
btw, what is your o1js version?

Hmm, the reason I think so is if one of the above constraints doesn't match, it will throw an unmatch assert equal error. And after I figured out all of them, this errow showed up.

Here is the link to the full code https://github.com/auxo-zk/Distributed-key-generation/blob/replace-merkle-map/src/contracts/Round2.ts#L150-L314
It's quite long so I don't think I should copy it in here 🥲
I'm using 0.14.1
Try also to compile small SmartContract BEFORE your ZkProgram. Don't use it, just compile
thanks for the insight, I will try running this
I'm setting proofEnable to false to avoid compiling the contracts every time running the test, could it be a problem?
You'd better test on testworld2, much closer to reality
Really, I didn't know that, I'm using only Local for testing. Is the testworld2 network using v0.14.1 too?
For example, this program runs normally using the same function https://github.com/auxo-zk/Distributed-key-generation/blob/replace-merkle-map/src/contracts/Round1.ts#L123-L293
Try also to remove from your ZkProgram Level1Witness completely (it is ok that the business logic will be bad) just to see what will happen. 70% probability that this error will go away.
Yes, you can call testworld using o1js
yeah I will try that, I believe the purpose is to reduce the constraints size right?
Update: I ran the script and it shows the program was using 2073 MB at the moment before calling the nextStep prover

Why did you call the function `updateOutOfSnark`?  Your intention is that the code is executed outside of the circuit, and the result is brought in?  Or do you expect the logic to execute in the circuit?

AFAIK, `if` statements are removed from the code during circuit compilation, so it would make sense to me that the code works sometimes - the times when the if statement is false, it's the same as if you never evaluated it.
I think there are no errors in the contract; it is just too big and needs some diet.🤣

Sorry for the bad naming, the idea of the function is to mimic the update of action state (by hashing the previous action state with the current action hash). I will test to see if this caused the problem, thanks for pointing out  😁

Sorry if I end up sending you down a rabbit hole for the wrong reason.  To me, the error reads as an assertion failure in the circuit, that's not mimicked in the JS.  Like I said, it executes multiple times.  First it tries in JS, so it can raise a helpful stack trace for you.  Once it passes JS, it runs the pickles proof, which spits out an error like this.  One reason why it can pass in JS and fail in pickles is a memory issue, but another reason is that the JS code and the pickles proof are not the same logic.  This can happen in cases where you use a dynamic array, or conditional logic that pickles doesn't understand.

Actually, the purpose is to decrease the size of input data to ZkProgram, don't think that the number of constraints is a problem here, although they are correlated. 

But before it make a compiling small SmartContract before ZkProgram, it requires less time and can solve the issue
